summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC Brooklyn, transmitting discovery materials related to her criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of the letter and the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. She is incarcerated at MDC Brooklyn.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority corresponding with the defendant Maxwell regarding discovery in her criminal case.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials via certified mail to Ghislaine Maxwell at her detention facility.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDC Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center, P.O. Box 329002, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell regarding her criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms that discovery materials were being provided to Maxwell as part of the legal process.
It indicates Maxwell was incarcerated at MDC Brooklyn under registration number 02879-509 as of September 2021.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, showing her office's direct involvement in the case.
